name: zheroen
text: A comment left by zheroen was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jthm_guitarist, TheLoneliestMonkey, keithcozz, alejandroadam)

name: mortshire
text: ooc, but another achewood line that has infiltrated my lexicon.

name: norrin
text: I just assume he only acts this way when he drinks tequila, and so he never drinks it. A lot of people do things they don't normally do when they drink tequilla.

name: macdaddyw
text: Like 50% of unwanted pregnancies

name: crumpetsandtea
text: Like getting "Star Wars" tatooed on your chest.

name: straw
text: SOMEone commented far too soon on the whole tattoo business!

name: porquechutzpah
text: or punch out a dude a foot taller than you because he was sitting down and your heels hurt your feet.

name: boredom_man
text: Call me.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: He always rates a drink by how afraid of the police he is.

name: idsyen
text: Really, that's a pretty decent criterion.

name: chuchurocket
text: this phrase is actually how a few of my friends and i gauge how drunk the other is. "you afraid of the police right now?"

name: woodenteeth
text:
My brother spent a night on the tequila once and decided that driving home was a sensational idea anyway. The cops woke my parents up and my brother came out yelling at them "You pricks have to find who stole my car!"

Someone had sited him running away from the scene after he skidded over a gutter, through a fence and lodged said vehicle fucking lengthwise between two trees.

name: dougthehead
text: Your brother's a pretty quick thinker, all things considered.

name: pohlhoud
text:
It actually was "remade" later where Cornelius used the same "line"
See for yourself

name: sparhawk
text: You made chubby, Det. Pohlhoud. Keep this up and you'll be a chubby seargent some day (seargent's better than detective, right?).

name: paperypip
text: Huh. I recognized the allusion to the earlier strip in that one, but for some reason thought that it was Lyle who said the original line.

name: waddlerz
text: Hence why Onstad needed someone with that personality...hello Raymond Smuckles!

name: 2kings
text: classic!

name: nyu
text: This is the strip that sold me on achewood.

name: stabones
text: agreed, this strip rocks

name: moot74
text: Yup, so long ago...

name: deusoma
text: Gah I accidentally gave you a lame instead of a cubby. Sorry bout that, this strip does indeed make me laugh every time I see it.

name: ravindra108
text: I agree. This is the first one that made me laugh uncontrollably.

name: mira
text: Was this the first time there was cussing in Achewood?

name: mrphaethon
text: A comment left by mrphaethon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, MrMojoRisin, Rhadamanthus, EM2, foolio, rowboat, prius_chaser, Rapid_Roy, Garyos)

name: tellumo
text: It's out of character for Cornelius today, but it's still one of my favorite lines.

name: lawbot
text: With hindsight, that makes this strip even more delicious.

name: science
text: One of the first strips that made me a regular reader.

name: overmedicated
text: My, how much the collective's knowledge of alcohols has grown.

name: senor_diablo
text:
Absolut brilliance! That's why I got a signed copy of this strip for my home bar!
Plus who wouldn't talk like that after the taste test?

name: overmedicated
text: Was Absolut a typo? Please say it wasn't.

name: gouldgonewild
text: I NEED  the answer to this question. Because that was hilarious

name: qatipay
text: True, out of character for Cornelius, but still so excellent.

name: lawbot
text: Actually I just seriously drank tequila for the first time, and I can corroborate that tequila is special in this way.

name: farqussus
text: Tequila makes me naked. If I could bring myself to type a frowny face right now, I would.

name: lux
text:
Tequila Naked = Frowny face?

You sure you're not doing shots of Scope or something?

name: gouldgonewild
text: I just wanted to say, that I liked that your status is Oh Comely.

name: lux
text: Heh, thanks. It's my favorite Neutral Milk Hotel song.

name: deimosrising
text: I have proclaimed this lack of fear on upwards of half of all times I have been intoxicated.

name: ambala
text: replace "vodka" and "bourbon" with some crazy expensive boutique liquor, and replace Cornelius with Ray, and this could be a recent strip...the humor is classic Achewood.

name: juancarlos
text: First two panels I'm thinking "mmm the whole meta-awareness of talking animals and stuffed bears never really worked" but the final made me chuckle.

name: gethen
text: T and CB are not fully realized as characters yet, but this has been a good one-off strip to send to people who aren't believers yet.

name: jokercross
text: Still playing with the reality construct.  I have yelled that last line after doing a shot more than once.

name: eric
text: Who hasn't yelled that after that combo of shots?

name: touchmenot
text: This was it. Maybe it's the alcohol theme, but this strip got me hooked.

name: rincewind
text: I'm just too distracted by how out of out-of-character these lines seem today to really enjoy this one. :(

name: a_dude
text: Tequila is a vile drink but it has it's uses.

name: dirtyantaeus
text: This strip is pure gold, no matter how out of character it is.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: If you guys think this is out of character, wait until you get to original Pat!

name: alejandroadam
text: A comment left by alejandroadam was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by le_chien_manquee, cailetshadow, Aerys)

name: jumpingjehosephat
text: This one of the traps I lay for the unsuspecting addict.

name: f1shst1ck
text: A comment left by f1shst1ck was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jtr, waitwhat, TheLoneliestMonkey)

name: stuart
text: Fuck along, now.

name: phthoggos
text: To be fair, we can't fault Mr. Bear for swearing in this one -- the whole joke is that the tequila instantly transforms his personality. The weird part is that today's Cornelius surely has an encyclopedic knowledge of all alcoholic beverages.

name: tombsgrave
text: The contrast between how Cornelius usually acts compared to the lack of policefear inspired by tequila makes this hilarious even today.

name: le_chien_manquee
text: so true

name: neitherman
text: Not only do you hear Cornelius' bad-assery, but you also see it in the thrown shotglass.  Awesome strip.

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: I originally thought he said "I am DEFINITELY not afraid of fucking the POLICE right now." I'm not sure which I like better.

name: spectre
text: Fucking the band or the cops? Tell us. We're here to help.

name: zapatos
text: Why not both?

name: editrix
text: Cornelius's outstanding "Fuck along, now" today shows that he's not afraid to do a grody mouth.

name: aarongstock
text: Also, remember who won The Badass Games .

name: hikikomori
text: Cornelius has no reason to be afraid of the police.  Ever.

name: boredom_man
text: Because when imprisoned, he always winds up with the tidiest roommates?

name: lux
text: The moderate German, of course.

name: shoinan
text: Nowadays I'm not sure any of the characters would fit into this strip. Most of the cast are established drinkers. He he, a similar strip with Phillipe might be funny :)

name: straw
text: This strip was my introduction to Achewood.  Ah the memories.  It was printed off and on my friend's fridge.

name: tellumo
text: A comment left by tellumo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, rachel, Appers)

name: tellumo
text:
Wait. What?

What the hell was I trying to say here. I mean, really, I have no idea. All I know is that it was about two years ago and that I was talkin' nonsense. I've known a few Mexican dudes who had no fear of the police at any point, but per capita it hasn't been more than dudes of any ethnicity who were unafraid of the police. Conclusion: some dudes just ain't afraid of the police no matter what comes, and Mexicans are basically shooting par as far as that category goes.

name: evolume
text: It's not out of character! It's tequila AND it's his 3rd shot!

name: morbo
text: sexyyy

name: rhymesforkids
text: this strip is hilarious!

name: molesticide
text:
man, how is this not true to character of cornelius?

how is this not true to character of ANYbody who takes a shot of vodka, bourbon, and tequila in what looks like less than twenty seconds?

the part that's out of character is he says "yeah" in the second panel.

name: audhumla
text: It seems out of character, perhaps, that Cornelius is not already well-versed in the effects and tastes of various liquors

name: pettytyrant
text: Whenever I recommend Achewood to my compatriots and comrades I refer them to this comic and the Nice Pete "killing is like basketball" comic.  I also recommend that the whole series works best if you read through the archives from the beginning.

name: wae
text: An All-Time Top 10 strip for me.

name: myrrdisparo
text:
For some reason, this strip, along with the "Food chain" one have always been among my favourites, and I couldn't explain why for either one.
I guess I just find stuffed animals yelling inherently funny. Is that a new fetish?

name: rachel
text:
this is the internet we are talking about here

there is no new fetish

name: quarantine
text: This is the strip that got me hooked.

name: skrizach
text: I love this strip

name: hyetal
text: Mr. Bear may be way out of character in this, but maybe that's why I love it so much.

name: rowboat
text: Definitely one of the best early strips, but (and I know this has been commented on ad nauseam) the old Cornelius is SO JARRING!  He beat Lyle to the punch profanity-wise!  In fact, he kind of IS Lyle here.  It's hard to take, knowing now what a Fine Gentleman he really is.

name: echidnaboy
text: I disagree. Inexperience of liquor is out of character for Cornelius, but outright inconceivable for Lyle. Also, Mr Bear's dialogue in panel 3 pretty much describes Lyle's default state.

name: rowboat
text: I'm not too good with reading, but it sounds kind of like you agree.

name: echidnaboy
text: My point was that Mr. Bear's behaviour doesn't remind me of Lyle, because Lyle is an even more experienced drinker than him. Furthermore, alcohol wouldn't inspire Lyle to say "I am DEFINITELY not afraid of the fucking POLICE right now," because he feels that way from the moment he wakes up in the mor... uh, I mean, afternoon.

name: stwee
text:
Cornelius may be messing with Teodor, perhaps for assuming that an elderly bear would need an alcohol tasting session, despite being such a certified (and award-winning) badass.
Or just playing along for the free booze.

name: shemmjacc
text: So is Lyle wearing a Mr. Bear costume?

name: thesoulbear
text: Its wierd how the early Mr. Bear is so much different, especially in this strip. You could switch the character's lines without much difference.

name: snowman
text: I think it's out of character for Cornelius, sure.  But that's the joke here.  He took a shot of tequila and got crazy.  The only thing that doesn't really work, continuity-wise, is that one would assume Cornelius has years of drinking experience, and would not be tasting these for the first time.  But who cares, what was Onstad supposed to do, write out complete biographies for each character before he started Achewood?  I, for one, really enjoy seeing the exploration and seeing these characters evolve.

name: snowman
text: Also, this was the first Achewood that I emailed someone.  She liked it.

name: kamet
text: I started at the beginning.. but this is the strip that made me fall madly, stalker-esque, in love with Achewood.  That line is great.. ESPECIALLY from Cornelius.

name: justa
text: This is basically why I had to stop drinking tequila.

name: coldfrog
text: Despite the lack of eventual character continuity, this is definitely one of my favorite earlier strips.

name: boopy
text: haw haw haw. oh such brilliance.

name: cyberia
text: One of the best early strips. Always makes me laugh.

name: fearless_tulips
text: He's only  a-scared of the po-po is 'Cuz He probably wanted to be one once...

name: hellame
text: I love saying this to my friends at the end of the evening and having them look at me blankly.  Screw them, I say.  At least I'm not afraid of the fucking police!

name: wonglers
text:
It has nothing to do with the Tequila ,
That's how Cornelius gets after 3 shots.

name: berami
text: I love this strip, though he's obviously drinking Jack, which isn't a bourbon.

name: dasilodavi
text: It's been awhile, but I believe THIS was the strip that got me into Achewood.

name: aseidel
text: I as well, I sling tequila for a living and this strip is now posted on the wall of the Mexican bar I work at.

name: sjb3
text: Why, oh why did Connie speak so colloquially in these early strips? I can't take him seriously. Nonetheless, classic Achewood is genius.

name: mrchuckletrouzd
text:
Still developing. A baby who cannot yet hold it's head up.

But Clever. Damned Clever.
